block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
COMEDY

Hasbrouck Heights Dave Andrews, standup. Friday at 9:30 p.m.; May 5 at 8 and 10:30 p.m. $12 and $15. Bananas Comedy Club, 283 Route 17 South. (201) 727-1090. Morristown ''Four Sides of 40,'' stand-up by Al Ducharme, Eric McMahon, Lenny Marcus and Patty Rosborough. Friday at 8 p.m. $20. The Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008.
FILM

Suffern International Film Festival, presented by Finkelstein Memorial Library: ''Riding Alone for Thousands of Miles,'' directed by Zhang Yimou; in Mandarin and Japanese with English subtitles. Tuesday at 7 p.m. $1 and $3. Cultural Arts Center, Rockland Community College, 145 College Road. (845) 732-8186.
FOR CHILDREN

Englewood ''Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka,'' musical by Leslie Bricusse and Anthony Newley, adapted from Roald Dahl's ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory''; presented by the Kennedy Center's ''Imagination Celebration.'' May 6 at 2 and 5 p.m. $8 to $22. Bergen Performing Arts Center, 30 North Van Brunt Street. (201) 227-1030. Newark Dance Jam, with members of the Montclair High School, Newark Arts High and Rutgers University's Mason Gross School of the Arts. Ages 10 and up. May 5 and 6. $13. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722. Princeton ''The Adventures of Perseus,'' puppet show written and directed by Christopher T. Parks. Ages 5 and up. April 29 at 11 a.m. $12. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. Red Bank ''Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka,'' musical by Leslie Bricusse and Anthony Newley, presented by the Kennedy Center's ''Imagination Celebration.'' Friday at 4 and 7 p.m. $10 to $25. Count Basie Theater, 99 Monmouth Street. (732) 842-9000. South Orange ''Cashore Marionettes: Simple Gifts,'' with the music of Vivaldi, Beethoven, Strauss and Copland. April 29 at 1 and 4 p.m. South Orange Performing Arts Center, 1 Sopac Way. (973) 313-2787. West Windsor ''Harry the Dirty Dog,'' musical by ArtsPower, adapted from the book by Gene Zion. May 5 at 2 and 4 p.m. $8 and $10. Kelsey Theater, West Windsor Campus, Mercer County Community College, 1200 Old Trenton Road. (609) 570-3333.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Bridgewater Jazz in Bridgewater: Banu Gibson, jazz singer. May 5 at 8 p.m. $15 and $20. Somerset County Vocational and Technical School Auditorium, Vogt Drive at North Bridge Street. (908) 526-8900. Camden Philip Glass, composer and pianist; a reception and question-and-answer session precede the concert at 6 p.m. April 29 at 8 p.m. $26 and $30. Gordon Theater, Rutgers University-Camden Campus, Third and Pearl Streets. (856) 225-2700. Englewood ''Sleeping Beauty,'' by the New Jersey Ballet. April 29 at 1 and 4:30 p.m. $20 to $35. Bergen Performing Arts Center, 30 North Van Brunt Street. (201) 227-1030. Monroe Princeton Symphony Orchestra. May 5 at 8 p.m. $18 to $20. Richard P. Marasco Performing Arts Center, 1629 Perrineville Road. (732) 521-4400, Extension 134. Montclair ''4 Cast: Unpredictable,'' by Trimpin and the Kronos Quartet. May 5 at 7:30 p.m. $35. Alexander Kasser Theater, Montclair State University, College Avenue and Red Hawk Road. (973) 655-5112. Morristown Eileen Ivers, Irish fiddler, with Immigrant Soul. Thursday at 8 p.m. $32 to $42. The Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008. New Brunswick Maurice Hines, tap dancer and choreographer. Through April 29. $40 to $45. Crossroads Theater, 7 Livingston Avenue. (732) 545-8100. New Brunswick Los Folkloristas, traditional music of Mexico and Latin America. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $20 to $30. State Theater, 15 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7469. Newark The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra. Through April 29. $20 to $78. Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater. Friday through May 6. $22 to $78. Discovery Concerts, concert-lecture series: ''Bach to the Future II,'' with the Discovery Orchestra; George Marriner Maull, conductor. May 6 at 3 p.m. $42. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722. Princeton Academy of Ancient Music, period-instrument orchestra. Monday at 8 p.m. $42 to $45. Complexions, modern dance. Tuesday at 8 p.m. $33 to $46. Bruce Hornsby, songwriter and pianist. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $35 to $50. Jigu, Chinese percussion ensemble; American debut. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $32 to $45. The Fab Faux, Beatles tribute band. May 5 at 8 p.m. $65. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. Princeton Princeton Pro Musica; works by Rachmaninoff, Schnittke and Bartok; a lecture at 3 p.m. precedes the concert. Sunday at 4 p.m. $38 and $45. Richardson Auditorium, Princeton University, Nassau Street. (609) 497-0020. Red Bank ''The Wizard of Oz,'' ballet by the Company of Dance Arts. Through April 29. $12 to $30. The Jersey Shore Rock-N-Soul Revue, tribute to Motown. Thursday at 8 p.m. $25 to $49.50. Chris Botti, trumpeter. May 5 at 8 p.m. $25 to $75. Count Basie Theater, 99 Monmouth Street. (732) 842-9000. South Orange ''SOMA, the Opera,'' by Squonk Opera. May 5 and 6. $50. South Orange Performing Arts Center, 1 Sopac Way. (973) 313-2787. Stockton Annual Raritan River Music Festival: The Newman and Oltman Guitar Duo. May 5 at 2:30 and 7:30 p.m. $12 to $23. Prallsville Mills , Route 29. (732) 873-3050. Union The Leyte Dance Theater, multimedia Filipino dance company. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $25 to $35. Wilkins Theater, Kean University, 1000 Morris Avenue. (908) 737-7469. Watchung Reverend Billy C. Wirtz, adult-oriented comic songwriter and pianist; presented by Sanctuary Concerts. May 6 at 7 p.m. $15. Watchung Arts Center, 18 Stirling Road. (908) 753-0190.
THEATER

Camden Shakespeare's ''Romeo and Juliet,'' presented by Aquila Theater Company. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $16 and $20. Walter K. Gordon Theater, Camden Center for the Arts, Rutgers University, Third and Pearl Streets. (856) 225-2700. Leonia ''The Real Inspector Hound,'' by Tom Stoppard, and ''Black Comedy,'' by Peter Shaffer; presented by the Players Guild of Leonia. Through May 13. $16 and $18. Civil War Drill Hall Theater, 130 Grand Avenue. (201) 947-9606. Long Branch ''Love and Murder,'' drama by Arthur Giron; premiere. Through May 6. $25 to $40. New Jersey Repertory Company, 179 Broadway. (732) 229-3166. Marlboro ''Brighton Beach Memoirs,'' comedy by Neil Simon, presented by the Marlboro Players. Friday through May 12. $14 to $18. Marlboro Middle School, Route 520 (between Wyncrest and Gordons Corner Roads). (732) 972-7217. Millburn ''Seven Brides for Seven Brothers,'' musical by Lawrence Kasha, David Landay, Johnny Mercer and Gene de Paul, adapted from the musical film directed by Stanley Donen. Through May 13. $23.25 to $72.25. Paper Mill Playhouse, 3 Brookside Drive. (973) 376-4343. Montclair "Little Beasts," premiere of the drama by Jeanne Marshall. Through May 20. $20 to $30. Luna Stage, 695 Bloomfield Avenue. (973) 744-3309. Morristown Cirque Le Masque, European circus. May 5 at 3 and 8 p.m. $25. ''The Myths and Legends of Ancient Greece: Old Echoes, New Ears,'' presented by Shakespeare LIVE. May 6 at 3 p.m. $15. The Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008. New Brunswick ''Falsettos,'' musical by William Finn and James Lapine. Through May 6. $28 to $64. George Street Playhouse, 9 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7717. New Brunswick ''Derby Day,'' premiere of the dark comedy by Samuel Brett Williams, presented by the Rutgers Theater Company. Through April 29. $15 to $25. Mason Gross Performing Arts Center, Douglass Campus, Rutgers University, 85 George Street. (732) 932-7511. New Brunswick ''The Canterbury Tales,'' presented by Aquila Theater Company. April 29 at 3 p.m. $20 to $35. ''Jesus Christ Superstar,'' musical by Tim Rice and Andrew Lloyd Webber. May 5 at 3 and 8 p.m. $40 to $65. State Theater, 15 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7469. Paramus ''Bury the Dead,'' drama by Irwin Shaw, presented by Bergen Community College Theater Productions. Through April 29. $7 and $10. Bergen Community College, 400 Paramus Road. (201) 447-7428. Princeton ''Mrs. Packard,'' premiere of the drama by Emily Mann; presented with the Kennedy Center. Friday through June 10. $35 to $48. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. Sussex Shakespeare's ''Twelfth Night,'' presented by the Tri-State Actors Theater. Through May 6. $17 to $27. Crescent Theater, 74 Main Street. (973) 875-2950. Teaneck ''Porcelain,'' drama by Chay Yew, presented by the Garage Theater Group. Through May 12. $32. Becton Theater, Fairleigh Dickinson University, 960 River Road. (201) 569-7710. West Windsor ''Woyzeck,'' drama by Georg Buchner, presented by drama students. Through April 29. $10 and $12. Kelsey Theater, West Windsor Campus, Mercer County Community College, 1200 Old Trenton Road. (609) 570-3333.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Cape May ''Small Towns, Black Lives: African American Communities in New Jersey,'' photography by Wendel A. White. Through May 13. $1 and $2. Mid-Atlantic Center for the Arts, 1048 Washington Street. (609) 884-5404. Chester ''Narrative Quilts,'' work by Margaret Beach. Through May 26. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 1 to 6 p.m. Second Story Gallery, 67 West Main Street. (908) 879-9001. Clifton ''A Face in the Crowd,'' group show by art students at Clifton High School. Through June 2. Reception: Thursday, 7 to 9 p.m. $1. Clifton Arts Center, 900 Clifton Avenue. (973) 472-5499. Clinton ''Barbara Klein: New Marks,'' abstract paintings, and ''How American Women Artists Invented Post Modernism,'' group show presented by the Feminist Art Project. Through June 3. Donation: $3. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hunterdon Museum of Art, 7 Lower Center Street. (908) 735-8415. Hopewell ''Double Take: Two Photographers, Two Coney Islands,'' works by Joanna Tully and Marty Schwartz. Through May 27. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Gallery 14, 14 Mercer Street. (609) 333-8511. Lambertville ''Constructions and Reconstructions,'' mixed media and photography by Nancy Shill and John Treichler. Through April 29. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 11 a.m.to 6 p.m., or by appointment. Artists' Gallery, 32 Coryell Street. (609) 397-4588. Lincroft ''Marsh Meditations: A Celebration of the Hamilton-Trenton Marsh,'' group show by artists from the Princeton Artists Alliance. Friday through June 10. Reception: Friday, 6 to 8 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Monmouth Museum, Brookdale Community College, Newman Springs Road. (732) 747-2266. Maplewood ''Raw Spirits: A Survey of Contemporary Folk and Outsider Art in America,'' group show. Through May 27. 1978 Arts Center, 1978 Springfield Avenue. (973) 275-9855. Montclair ''Dreaming of a Speech Without Words: The Painting and Early Objects of H. C. Westermann.'' Through May 27. $6 to $8; free for members and children 12 and under. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Montclair Art Museum, 3 South Mountain Avenue. (973) 746-5555. Morristown Oil-on-linen works by Nicole Schmolzer. Through May 26. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, noon to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Simon Gallery, 48 Bank Street. (973) 538-5456. New Brunswick ''Natvar Bhavsar: The Dimensions of Color,'' paintings. Through July 22. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Jane Voorhees Zimmerli Art Museum, 71 Hamilton Street. (732) 932-7237. Newark ''Mexicana: Discovering Mexican Popular Arts, 1919-1950.'' Through Nov. 25. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, noon to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., October through June; noon to 5 p.m., July through September. The Newark Museum, 49 Washington Street. (973) 596-6493. Oceanville ''Sightings: Recent Works by Doug and Mike Starn,'' photography. Tuesday through Aug. 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays noon to 5 p.m. Noyes Museum of Art, 733 Lily Lake Road. (609) 652-8848. Princeton ''History, Identity, or None of the Above: Regarding African American Art,'' mixed-media exhibit. Through May 13. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Princeton University Art Museum, Nassau and Witherspoon Streets. (609) 258-3788. Skillman Group show by the A-Team Artists of Trenton. Through May 6. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Montgomery Center for the Arts, 124 Montgomery Road. (609) 921-3272. South Orange ''Cathexis: Art of Obsession,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 6. ''Poetry at Pierro,'' poetry readings and open mike, April 29, 2 to 4 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Pierro Gallery, 5 Mead Street. (973) 378-7755. Summit ''Wes Sherman: Recent Works,'' paintings. Through May 19. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Domo Gallery, 447 Springfield Avenue. (908) 608-0079. Union ''As I See It,'' photography by Jane H. Rapp. Through June 13. Les Malamut Art Gallery, 1800 Morris Avenue. (908) 851-5450. Upper Montclair ''Narcissus,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 29. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Sundays by appointment. Gallery of Modern Symbolism, 594 Valley Road.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.

Through April 29. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Sundays by appointment. Gallery of Modern Symbolism, 594 Valley Road.
